options.text: "Ain't nobody got the right to spy on my kin!" shouts @@RANDOM_NAME@@ at a gun rights demonstration outside the capitol building. "It's trespassing is what it is! If you can't climb through my window and take pictures of my house, why should you be able to do it with a flying doohickey? It's my god-given right to shoot down anything that violates my airspace, dagnabbit!" [[color=blue]Guns are legal[/color]]
options.result: belligerent citizens shoot at passing clouds for 'violating their airspace'

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: absence of drug laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: absence of drug laws

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: restrictive gun laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: restrictive gun laws

options.text: "Ain't nobody got the right to spy on my kin!" shouts @@RANDOM_NAME@@ while waving a compound crossbow. "It's trespassing is what it is! If you can't climb through my window and take pictures of my house, why should you be able to do it with a flying doohickey? It's my god-given right to shoot down anything that violates my airspace, dagnabbit!" [[color=red]Guns are restricted from public use[/color]]
options.result: crossbow bolts fill the skies if so much as a sparrow flies overhead

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: restrictive gun laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: restrictive gun laws

options.text: "Wait, what? What's your beef with drones?" says @@RANDOM_NAME@@ while piloting a miniature helicopter up to your face. "It's just a harmless way of having fun. This 'spying' stuff is the paranoid ranting of hillbillies looking for an excuse to shoot whatever they please. The government should just mind its own business and butt out of our hobbies."
options.result: citizens have to dodge their neighbors' drones while getting the morning paper

options.text: "Why do we even allow unmanned aircraft in the first place?" says @@RANDOM_NAME@@, president of the Sunday Fliers, a local private pilot's club. "It's obvious that these drones cause nothing but trouble. Just require that any man-made objects flying overhead have a pilot. If they get a little too close with their cameras, we can try the pilots for trespassing."
options.result: geosynchronous satellites are now manned by unpaid interns

options.text: "Obviously we can't just let anyone run around with these things - that would be ludicrous!" sputters the Chief of Police of Cape @@NAME@@. "However, these drones could certainly help my department find fugitives, carry out investigations, y'know, that sort of thing. Who knows, we could even check up on our citizens every now and again too. There's probably loads of illegal things folks are up to because they think they won't get caught."
options.result: police drones follow every suspected Peeping Tom
